definition: to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly

sentences.english: Governance dating history has the advantage of in-depth, which is hard to link up Juxian.

sentences.english: It is essential to identify the colour of ancient jade in dividing the generation of ancient jade.
sentences.chinese: 对古玉颜色的鉴别是玉器鉴赏与断代的重要依据。

sentences.english: The collection of knowledge, is the detection of forgeries of works of art dating to the foundation.
sentences.chinese: 这些知识的集合，正是对艺术品进行辨伪断代的基础。

sentences.english: A review on the thermoluminescence dating is presented.
sentences.chinese: 本文评述了热释光断代的近况。

sentences.english: But the period synonym research on ancient Chinese is still a feeble link.
sentences.chinese: 但古汉语同义词的断代研究，迄今还是一个薄弱环节。

sentences.english: The Xia-Shang-Zhou Chronology Project aims at draw up of chronological table scientifically.

definition: handed down from ancient times/family heirloom
to pass on (to future generations)/passed on (from former times)/a continued tradition/an inheritance
a decade of a century (e.g. the Sixties)/age/era/period/CL:個|个[ge4]
Xia, Shang and Zhou, the earliest named Chinese dynasties
bronze implement/refers to ancient bronze artifacts, from c. 2,000 BC
chronology (the science of determining the dates of past events)
